title: Randomized block design for treatments by age

content.question: To compare the effectiveness of two treatments, researchers conducted a well-designed experiment using a randomized block design in which the subjects were blocked by age-group (under <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years and <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years or older). Which of the following must be true about the randomized block design of the experiment?

choices.label: The number of subjects in each block is different.
Treatments are randomly assigned to subjects within each block.
The design cannot have a control group because subjects are blocked by age-group.
The experiment uses a matched-pairs design, where subjects from one block are paired with subjects from the other block.
The subjects in one block receive one treatment, and the subjects in the other block receive the other treatment.

content.answer: Treatments are randomly assigned to subjects within each block.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
